alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 5:43PM MDT until September 11 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... * Until 830 PM MDT. * At 543 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Coyote and Youngsville. Between 1.25 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Youngsville and Coyote. This includes Highway 96 between Coyote and Youngsville. High and fast flows are also possible in Coyote Creek, Rito Encino and the Rio Puerco. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
